entry.title: Release gated Skia API change in SkFontArguments::PaletteOverride
entry.content:
In the mentioned bug below, Skia changes the API type for the index of a

color override from an int to a uint16_t type as that is closer to the

font specification and avoids issues in ensuring the value is

positive. That change was gated by a define

SK_DISABLE_SKFONTARGS_CHANGED_TYPE. Remove that define from Chromium

compilation and adapt Blink type usage where needed.



Bug: b/317330945

entry.title: WebNN: Fix constant-only graph compute failure for DirectML backend
entry.content:
Some graphs may only have constant operands as graph input. For such

graphs, DirectML backend won’t need to allocate upload and input GPU

buffers during graph initialization, and copy the input data to those

buffers during graph computing.



This CL also adds the unit tests that build and compute constant-only

graphs for both DirectML and XNNPACK backends.



Bug: 1513582,1273291

entry.title: [Autofill] Make AutofillDriver::ApplyFormAction return a base::flat_set
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/5158569 changed the ApplyFormAction()'s return type from

std::vector to std::set for performance

reasons.



Profiling suggests this was regression.



In practice, this is completely irrelevant because the code is cold and

cheap for any reasonable container. Don't take this CL seriously :-)



I considered the following options:

(1) std::set (status quo before this CL)

(2) std::vector (status quo before crrev.com/c/5158569),

optionally with reserve().

(3) base::flat_set, optionally with reserve() or with

an auxiliary std::vector during construction.



Option (1) is essentially the worst. In my tests it was outperformed by

Option (2) for N <= 160, even by 2x for N <= 50 and by 4x for N <= 20,

and by Option (3) for every N.



Option (2) even beats all variants of Option (3) for N <= 90. It's

probably rare that N > 90, so from that perspective, std::vector might

be the best choice.



One argument for Option (3) could be its explicit "set" semantics. On

the other hand, we don't make this explicit for many other collections

of fields.



A better argument for Option (3) is that BrowserAutofillManager turns

the container into a base::flat_set anyway to pass it to some logging

code (where crrev.com/c/5158569 is a regression). We could address this

either by migrating the logging code to std::vector or by creating a

base::flat_set from the beginning.



At this point, I think the "set" semantics of base::flat_set outweighs

the (irrelevant :-)) performance advantages of std::vector, so I went

for Option (3).



This CL implements Option (3) with reserve(), which improves

performance by 8%--16%. I decided against an additional std::vector

because this only pays off if N > 50 and the FieldGlobalIds aren't

pre-sorted. And more importantly it just clutters the code.



Bug: 1505741

Change-Id: I80030f16b184053682c1c2ab715a7a13dea3b9e0

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5166329

Reviewed-by: Jihad Hanna

Commit-Queue: Christoph Schwering

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

entry.title: [iOS][a11y] Dismiss family picker before displaying sharing status
entry.content:
* Presents sharing status VC on family picker dismissal completion

(otherwise sharing status is presented above the family picker messing

up with VoiceOver and also being visible when sharing status is

draggen down; not considering the alternative of pushing status on top

of family picker since there is no possibility to navigate back

anyway)

* Removes `navigationController` from family picker (it wasn't really

used anyway)

* Handles cleaning up sharing coordinators when family picker is swiped

down with UIAdaptivePresentationControllerDelegate instead of doing it

in `viewDidDisappear`

entry.title: [@scope] Produce kScopeActivation relations for scoped nesting
entry.content:
When parsing style rules that are immediate children of an @scope rule,

any compound selector which contains either :scope or '&' is prepended

with RelationType::kScopeActivation. This relation is what triggers

the "figure out if we're indeed in scope, and what the scoping root is"-

behavior during SelectorChecker, and without the kScopeActivation, we'll

just fall back to the regular behavior for :scope (i.e. it matches :root

in the normal cases).



This CL fixes a bug which caused missing kScopeActivations for nested

style rules within @scope, e.g.:



@scope (a) {

b {

/* :scope needs to refer to 'a' here */

:scope:not(&) { ... }

}

}



This doesn't work, because we're basing the kScopeActivation emit/no-emit

decision on the nesting type of the *immediate* parent rule, which in this

case is CSSNestingType::kNesting. We need to know whether any ancestor

rule is an @scope rule, and so we propagate a flag for this, and base

the emit/no-emit decision on this instead.



Fixed: 1512217

Change-Id: I35d28489dd8255badd2e9a9c911fda3e2541bb52

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5164291

Reviewed-by: Rune Lillesveen

Auto-Submit: Anders Hartvoll Ruud

Commit-Queue: Rune Lillesveen

entry.title: [Signin][Android] Observe the AccountManagerFacade in the SigninChecker
entry.content:
This CL also fixes some tests that were failing when the

SeedAccountsRevamp flag was enabled by doing the following:

1) The SigninChecker should observe the AccountManagerFacade and needs

to depend on the SigninManager regardless of whether the flag is

enabled.

2) The SigninCheckerTests need to be updated to reflect the fact that

the child account status is no longer checked on activity startup.

3) The SigninManagerIntegrationTests should explicitly set the primary

account by signing in and should not explicitly reload the accounts when

the flag is enabled.

4) Tests no longer need to wait for seeding when the flag is enabled.



Bug: 1491005

Change-Id: I84b1bbc6c169a40a49ad85d1e5a09adf7c913195

entry.title: kiosk: Dismiss the "launch cancelled" toast after sign in
entry.content:
The "Kiosk application launch cancelled" toast is shown by the

kiosk_apps_menu_controller.cc in the lock screen after the user cancels

Kiosk launch. Currently the toast remains open until the user manually

clicks "dismiss". This leads to a dangling pointer once the lock screen

is destroyed.



This change makes sure the toast is dismissed when destroying the lock

screen.



Fixed: b:316344752

Test: testing/xvfb.py tools/autotest.py -C out/Default --run-all ash/login/login_screen_controller_unittest.cc

Change-Id: I674fb4b91713b3a94ea03c8a945aa60ead4425b9

entry.title: Don't use mocked time in AutofillInteractiveTestDynamicForm
entry.content:
Currently, the test uses (Test)Autofill(Tick)Clock to make sure that

refills (do not) happen, as intended. This was added to avoid flakiness

on slow bots. This CL instead adds a test-API function to adjust the

kLimitBeforeRefill used by the BAM.



This introduces additional state to the BAM, which is suboptimal. But it

unblocks crrev.com/c/5134896 - and as discussed in [1], seems like a

bullet we're willing to bite.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5134896/comment/43cbaf53_2358c2ba/



Bug: 1007974

entry.content:

entry.title: Add RootId to OcrService in PdfAccessibilityTree.
entry.content:
The a11y tree can reset while OCR service is running and the service

should be able to find out if a result belongs to a previous tree or

not. To do so, the root id is passed to the service, is kept in each

request, and is checked to be correct before OCR results are sent to

the tree.

entry.title: [base] Integrate Sequence and Thread Checker with RunOrPostTask.
entry.content:
-- Sequence Checker --



Inside a task run synchronously by RunOrPostTask,

CalledOnValidSequence() behaves like in a posted task.



-- Thread Checker --



Inside a task run synchronously by RunOrPostTask,

CalledOnValidThread() returns true iff the Thread Checker was bound

on the same thread and:

- Outside of a task [1], or,

- Inside the same task.



A Thread Checker bound inside a task run synchronously by

RunOrPostTask only returns true from CalledOnValidThread() within that

same task.



-- Implementation details --



We now lazily assign a SequenceToken to each thread. This ensures

that all bound Sequence Checkers are associated with a valid

SequenceToken (they could previously be assigned to an invalid

SequenceToken). In a scope where RunOrPostTask runs a task

synchronously, the current SequenceToken is set to the SequenceToken

captured when the SequenceManager was bound to its thread. This allows

Sequence Checker to behave the same way in a task run synchronously by

RunOrPostTask and in a posted task (even if the Sequence Checker was

bound before the SequenceManager was instantiated or bound to its

thread).



We no longer return false from CalledOnValidThread() when the Thread

Checker was bound from a different task, bound to a valid sequence

token, there is no default SingleThreadTaskRunner on the calling

thread and TLS wasn't destroyed on the calling thread. This is because

Thread Checker are now always bound to a valid SequenceToken. We rely

on a new method CurrentTaskIsThreadBound() to determine if

CalledOnValidThread() is deterministically or fortuitously called

from the bound thread.



We modified GpuWatchDogThread to use

DCHECK(task_runner()->RunsTasksInCurrentSequence()) instead of a

Sequence Checker. The GpuWatchDogThread can be stopped and started

again [2]. Previously, its Sequence Checker falled back to

PlatformThreadRef to verify sequenced execution, because it was bound

to an invalid SequenceToken. By chance, the PlatformThreadRef was

reused across restarts, so checks passed. Now that Sequence Checkers

are always bound to a valid SequenceToken, checks wouldn't pass

(SequenceToken isn't the same on the old and new threads).



[1] ThreadGroupImpl::WorkerThreadDelegateImpl::worker_thread_checker_

depends on this.

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:content/gpu/gpu_main.cc;l=450;drc=8e78783dc1f7007bad46d657c9f332614e240fd8



Bug: 1503967

Change-Id: I295ecd716884ab97da7037ad1494d11235ce7865

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5074212

Commit-Queue: Maggie Chen

Reviewed-by: Maggie Chen

Reviewed-by: Etienne Pierre-Doray

Auto-Submit: Francois Pierre Doray

entry.title: [AWC] Make sure window.moveTo|moveBy are not blocked by setResizable
entry.content:
In `WebContents` we only know the size of the contents to be and the

window (including contents and frame) so moving the check to `BrowserView`.



Also making sure that the blocking only triggers for when it's actually

a resize and not a move event (where the window rect / bounds also change).



Also adding a new test to make sure the bug doesn't repro.

entry.title: Revert "When testing MPC hits for matching inherited data, compare by-value."
entry.content:
This reverts commit c9c6c875f6b8df9aeba5653c60571143e475ba08.



Reason for revert: Suspected culprit for Builder: Linux CFI (more details in bug https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1515486



Original change's description:

> When testing MPC hits for matching inherited data, compare by-value.

>

> This makes for a more expensive comparison, but we get it back by

> getting complete MPC hits more often -- saving both RAM and CPU.

> (The effect is especially pronounced on style recalcs, where the

> MPC already most likely contains nearly everything we'd want.)

> In particular, if two elements get the same state from different

> parts in the tree, the pointers are not the same, but the data

> is equivalent. E.g.

>

> * div

> * div class="a"

> * span class="b"

> * div class="a"

> * span class="b" <-- would get a partial MPC hit before, full now

>

> Note also that there is a knock-on effect from reusing the ComputedStyle

> from the MPC hit, in that any similar children of the two spans would

> now automatically have the same group pointers for inherited data,

> too (so when we get a match, we don't need the by-value comparison for

> all the children; the pointers will be the same and the comparison will

> short-circuit).

>

> This saves a large amount of ComputedStyle RAM:

>

> Video 766 → 395 kB ( -371 kB)

> Extension 3002 → 1670 kB (-1332 kB)

> News 1724 → 1442 kB ( -282 kB)

> ECommerce 238 → 198 kB ( -40 kB)

> Social1 755 → 588 kB ( -167 kB)

> Social2 536 → 461 kB ( -75 kB)

> Encyclopedia 1658 → 1293 kB ( -365 kB)

> Sports 541 → 409 kB ( -132 kB)

> Search 415 → 238 kB ( -177 kB)

>

> It would be possible to force-rewrite equivalent pointers into

> each other to save yet more RAM (one of them could be GC-ed away

> even if we did not have an MPC match), but from a quick prototyping,

> the effect is mostly small, and it costs a little more CPU (~1%).

>

> It also saves CPU (style perftest, Zen 2, LTO but no PGO):

>

> Initial style (µs) Before After Perf 95% CI (BCa)

> =================== ========= ========= ======= =================

> ECommerce 8456 8373 +1.0% [ +0.4%, +1.5%]

> Encyclopedia 71749 70657 +1.5% [ +1.0%, +2.4%]

> Extension 93541 86623 +8.0% [ +7.2%, +8.6%]

> News 36167 35159 +2.9% [ +2.4%, +3.7%]

> Search 10621 10295 +3.2% [ +2.7%, +3.7%]

> Social1 20412 19897 +2.6% [ +2.1%, +3.1%]

> Social2 13418 13165 +1.9% [ +1.3%, +2.6%]

> Sports 39573 38658 +2.4% [ +1.3%, +6.3%]

> Video 30046 27558 +9.0% [ +8.5%, +9.6%]

> Geometric mean +3.6% [ +3.0%, +4.1%]

>

> Recalc style (µs) Before After Perf 95% CI (BCa)

> =================== ========= ========= ======= =================

> ECommerce 5267 4418 +19.2% [+18.1%, +20.5%]

> Encyclopedia 59969 56885 +5.4% [ +5.0%, +6.3%]

> Extension 79453 70043 +13.4% [+12.2%, +14.5%]

> News 27126 22136 +22.5% [+21.5%, +23.6%]

> Search 5500 4340 +26.7% [+25.4%, +27.8%]

> Social1 12423 10405 +19.4% [+18.1%, +20.4%]

> Social2 9104 8050 +13.1% [+11.8%, +14.1%]

> Sports 22436 19062 +17.7% [+15.0%, +26.9%]

> Video 17912 12632 +41.8% [+40.8%, +42.8%]

> Geometric mean +19.6% [+18.5%, +20.8%]

>

> Speedometer3, M1 Pinpoint (lower is better except Score,

> significant results at 95% CI only, ordered by increasing goodness):

>

> TodoMVC-JavaScript-ES6-Webpack [ +0.6%, +2.2%]

> TodoMVC-React-Redux [ +0.2%, +0.9%]

> Editor-TipTap [ +0.2%, +0.6%]

> Charts-chartjs [ -0.9%, -0.1%]

> TodoMVC-Backbone [ -0.8%, -0.1%]

> TodoMVC-JavaScript-ES5 [ -0.8%, -0.1%]

> TodoMVC-jQuery [ -0.8%, -0.2%]

> TodoMVC-React [ -1.1%, -0.3%]

> TodoMVC-Angular [ -1.5%, -0.3%]

> TodoMVC-Preact [ -3.0%, -1.4%]

> TodoMVC-React-Complex-DOM [ -3.7%, -2.6%]

> TodoMVC-WebComponents [ -5.5%, -4.8%]

> TodoMVC-Lit [ -6.6%, -5.7%]

>

entry.title: Ignore disconnect signals when a QUIC connection migration is happening on the default network
entry.content:
Suppose that both wifi and mobile networks are active and the default

network is wifi. When wifi becomes unavailable, there could be two

signals from NetworkChangeNotifier via NetworkObserver to trigger

a QUIC connection migration:

- OnNetworkDisconnected() to signal wifi becomes inactive

- OnNetworkMadeDefault() to signal mobile becomes the default network



The former doesn't require proving, but the latter requires proving.



The order of these signals is not guaranteed. Before this CL,

QuicChromiumClientSession didn't handle the case where

OnNetworkMadeDefault() comes first and the OnNetworkDisconnected()

comes next. There was no valid connection IDs until proving finished,

but QuicChromiumClientSession::OnNetworkDisconnectedV2() tried to

migrate immediately, resulting in a migration failure.



To avoid the problem, ignore disconnect signals when a migration is

happening on the default network.



The existing QuicConnectionMigrationTest.Basic test will cover this

change once it starts running on bots.



Bug: 1509458

Change-Id: I9b348ad82ef004800356f5b63c1f702c1d09ccca

entry.content:
Adds a pref to track whether a user is new for the sake of the holding

space wallpaper nudge. This is necessary because "new" users should be

shown the nudge, but they may not take the triggering action on their

very first session. Capturing that newness and storing it will allow the

nudge to be displayed as appropriate.

entry.title: Manual raw_ptr rewrite: //components/omnibox/.../autocomplete_match.h
entry.content:
The main change in the CL is in

//components/omnibox/browser/autocomplete_match.h where the type of the

`AutocompleteMatch::provider` field is changed from a native pointer

(`AutocompleteProvider*`) into `raw_ptr`. This

follows the guidance from //base/memory/raw_ptr.md to use `raw_ptr`

for all class and struct fields (wherever possible).



Other changes in this CL support the main change outlined above:



* For equality comparison a native pointer needs to be extracted using

an explicit `.get()`

* Various tweaks need to be made to avoid (short-lived) dangling

pointers (detected thanks to the Dangling Pointer Detector that is

enabled by default for all `raw_ptr`).

entry.title: Launch the pending request after OnApps.
entry.content:
This CL is used to prepare for CL:5138416, to fix the browser

tests: WebKioskTest.AlreadyInstalledOffline.



The current code implement the launching saved in the pending list

after registerring the publisher. Well, OnApps are implemented after

registerring the publisher, and it could be async, e.g. Chrome apps

publisher, web apps publisher. So if the launch request is sent to the

publisher too early, when the app platform is not ready yet, the launch

process could fail.



Modify the code to implement the pending launch request after OnApps,

so that we can know which apps have been removed, and implement the

launching request for valid apps only after the app platform is ready.



BUG=1385932, b:307623506



Change-Id: Ib55a524f5abd1b26a9060e229a35bf4c329d6ef1

entry.title: [Code Health] Remove some uses of base::SupportsWeakPtr. (pm)
entry.content:
This CL removes base::SupportsWeakPtr as a base class of by doing

the following:



1. Any abstract base classes that derived from SupportsWeakPtr

now have a pure virtual member function that returns a WeakPtr

to the base class.



2. Any class that derives from one of the abstract base class has

a new base::WeakPtrFactory data member and overrides the function

to return a WeakPtr from the factory. For added safety, these

classes are marked final when possible.



3. Any implementation class that uses SupportsWeakPtr now has a

member function that returns a WeakPtr and a new WeakPtrFactory

data member. For added safety, these classes are marked final when

possible.



In some cases, implementation classes already had a WeakPtrFactory

data member, so this fixes the inconsistency of WeakPtr instances

being generated by the SupportsWeakPtr base class and the data

member.



Bug: 647430

Change-Id: Ic42351ec8496a080c79f0a951710116551f590b3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5142396

entry.title: Implement new schema and time based removal into CdmStorageDatabase
entry.content:
A new schema is introduced into CdmStorageDatabase to add last_modified

and file_size to be able to support time-based deletion and time-based

usage calculation.



Methods were implemented to delete by time frame, by storage key, and

to calculate file size using SQL queries for time frames by storing

the file size into the CdmStorageDatabase to be a one time operation.



This CL also provides the functionality that automatically deletes the

database if a Delete function for a subset (i.e file, storage key,

time-frame) ends up removing entries such that there are no more entries

in the database.



An SQL statement is used to alter the version1 database so that we don't

run into crashes when a user that already has the CdmStorageDatabase

v1.0 in their profile runs into queries that are made for the v2.0, such

as writing into the column file_size, since file_size is only in v2.0.



Testing: unittests +



Manual Testing Steps for the Schema Alter code:

1. Build chrome on main branch.

2. Go to chrome://flags and enable kCdmStorageDatabase and

kCdmStorageDatabaseMigration.

3. Open a new profile, name it CdmStorageDatabase (or anything you want)

4. Play this website: https://integration.staging.widevine.com/player?contentUrl=https://storage.googleapis.com/wvtemp/hmchen/poc/tears_hd_cenc.mpd&proxyServerUrl=https://proxy.uat.widevine.com/proxy?video_id=GTS_CAN_PLAY_CLIENT_TOKEN%26provider=widevine_test%26full_response=true&persistentStateRequired=true

5. Log the kVersionNumber (should be 1) (I did this through LOG(ERROR)).

6. A value should be written.

7. Quit Chrome.

8. Switch your branch to these changes using git and build chrome.

9. Open chrome, verify the same flags are still enabled, and open

the same profile you used as before.

10. Play same website as step #4.

11. log the kVersionNumber (should be 2) (I did this through LOG(ERROR))

12. View in chrome://histograms/Media.EME that the

IncompatibleDatabaseDetected histogram was triggered.

13. Verify that playback plays continuously and Chrome does not crash.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAMS= Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.DeleteDatabaseError.Incognito, Media.EME.CdmStorageManager.DeleteDatabaseError.NonIncognito.



Bug: 1454512

Change-Id: I64f9dff580114545ececf5d7b4f03124b1f55192

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4994868

Reviewed-by: Evan Stade

Reviewed-by: Evan Liu

Reviewed-by: John Rummell

Commit-Queue: Vikram Pasupathy

entry.title: firmware_update: Add metric to track request duration of failed installs
entry.content:
This CL adds a new metric type called `ChromeOS.FirmwareUpdateUi.FailedRequestDuration

.RequestId{DeviceRequestId}`.



This metric records the duration and ID of a request if there was one

active at the time of an install failure. This metric can be used to

understand timeout durations and which kinds of requests are failing.

entry.title: Change the calendar default view to show more dates
entry.content:
This CL changed the calendar default view so that there are at least two

more rows under today's row. Here are some cases:

- If there are already at least two more rows under today's row, do

nothing.

- If there are less than two rows under today's row:

- If the calendar bubble is big enough, scroll up today's row so that

today's row is visible and there are two rows under today's row.

- If the calendar bubble is small, scroll to today's row.

- If the up next view exists:

- If the calendar bubble is big enough, scroll up today's row so that

today's row is visible and there are two rows under today's row

that is not hidden by the up next view.

- If the calendar bubble is small or today's date is hidden by the up

next view, scroll to today's row.



Screenshot:

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9kM86nKhCoyNmCW
